New Records: José Ramírez was one shy of hitting 40 home runs and becoming the seventh player in MLB history to achieve a 40-40 season (40 home runs, 40 stolen bases, and 40 doubles).
Key Match Events: The game was canceled due to a 3-hour rain delay, denying José Ramírez a chance to hit his 40th home run and join the exclusive 40-40 club.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was originally scheduled to take place on September 29, 2024, but was delayed and eventually canceled due to heavy rain.
Post-Match Reflections: The cancellation prevented José Ramírez from achieving a rare 40-40-40 season, which had only been accomplished by Alfonso Soriano in 2006.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game's cancellation affected the Guardians' and Astros' playoff preparation, with the Guardians set to host the ALDS and the Astros facing the Detroit Tigers in the AL wild-card series.
Others: The article also provided updates on other players, such as Yordan Alvarez's knee sprain and Alex Cobb's return from injury.
